headline: NCDC confirms 21 suspected Monkeypox cases, 1 death

headline: American Ted Sams graduates 60 years later: His touching story
summarized_story:

Back in 1962 when he was a high school senior, Sams got in trouble and was suspended five days before the end of the school year.
“When I went back with my grade, they wouldn’t give me my diploma because I owed $4.80 for a book,” Sams told KABC-TV.
“And so I just walked away and said forget it.”The school still had Sams’ original diploma locked away in an old filing cabinet.

Obi’s Campaign Director, Doyin Okupe confirmed that other aspirants in the race like Professor Pat Utomi, Faduri Joseph and Olushola Emmanuel-Tella stepped down for him.
Emmanuel-Tella who was the only female aspirant had initially stood her ground that she would not step down for Obi but eventually did so.
Addressing delegates earlier, Obi said he is ready to restructure Nigeria and it’s time for the people to come out and vote.

headline: Jonathan Won’t Be APC Presidential Flagbearer – Hilliard Eta
summarized_story: Against the backdrop of purported moves to impose former Nigeria President Goodluck Jonathan as presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress, Hilliard Eta, a former National Vice Chairman (South South) of the APC and supporter of Asiwaju Bola Tinubu’s aspiration, is emphatic the Jonathan option is dead on arrival.

headline: Egypt Court Jails Former Presidential Candidate for 15 Years
summarized_story:
Aboul Fotouh, 70, who suffers from several medical conditions according to his family, was sentenced to 15 years in prison subject to appeal, the court ruling said on Sunday.
RelatedStories No Content AvailableMohamed al-Qassas, the deputy head of Aboul Fotouh’s Strong Egypt party, received a 10-year sentence.
Rights groups have repeatedly criticised such mass sentencings in Egypt and called on authorities to ensure fair trials.
Aboul Fotouh is a former senior Brotherhood leader who was sacked from the group in 2011 when he decided to run in Egypt’s presidential elections.
Egypt banned the Brotherhood after Sisi, then army chief, led the overthrow of democratically-elected Brotherhood President Mohamed Mursi following mass protests in 2013.

headline: Heavy Fighting as Russian Troops Enter Sievierodonetsk in Eastern Ukraine
summarized_story:
Russian troops have entered the outskirts of the Ukrainian city of Sievierodonetsk, the regional governor said on Monday, describing “very fierce” fighting in the ruins of a city that has become the focus of Moscow’s offensive.
RelatedStories No Content AvailableIncessant shelling has left Ukrainian forces defending ruins in Sievierodonetsk, but their refusal to withdraw has slowed the massive Russian offensive across the Donbas region.
Luhansk region governor Serhiy Gaidai said Russian troops had advanced into the city’s southeastern and northeastern fringes.
But he said Ukrainian forces had driven the Russians out of the village of Toshkivka to the south, potentially frustrating Moscow’s push to encircle the area.
Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Sunday said the “liberation” of the Donbas was an “unconditional priority” for Moscow.

headline: Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov Denies Putin Illness
summarized_story:
Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has denied speculation that President Vladimir Putin is ill.
In an interview with French TV, Mr Lavrov said the Russian leader appears in public every day, and no sane person would see any signs of an ailment.
There has been increasing unconfirmed media speculation that Mr Putin, who turns 70 this year, may be suffering from ill health, possibly cancer.
Mr Lavrov said the “liberation” of the eastern region was an “unconditional priority” for Russia.
Mr Lavrov told TF1 that winning in “the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, recognised by the Russian Federation as independent states, is an unconditional priority”.
